thread.title: Ian Wright Believes Arsenal Player Had "The Most Pitiful 45 Minutes I've Seen" Against Watford
thread.title_full: Ian Wright Believes Arsenal Player Had "The Most Pitiful 45 Minutes I've Seen" Against Watford

title: Ian Wright Believes Arsenal Player Had "The Most Pitiful 45 Minutes I've Seen" Against Watford
text:
Ian Wright Believes Arsenal Player Had "The Most Pitiful 45 Minutes I've Seen" Against Watford Thu Feb 02 2017 19:07:36   19:07:36   Jack Kenmare in football 
Arsenal were booed off the pitch after their 2-1 defeat to Watford on Tuesday night as fans and pundits voiced their disappointment after the final whistle, including former striker ian Wright. 
Wright, who didn't hold back when describing Arsenal's fortunes, said the performances are "showing that the team are not accountable" and he doesn't feel that Wenger's side "get themselves up for certain games." 
Despite winning five of seven games played in January, Wright was critical of their recent performances: 
"That was as bad as a first 45 minutes I've seen. It's inexcusable. Wright told The Sun Football Podcast 
"Arsene Wenger said before the game the players were ready and then afterwards he said the team wasn't ready. " 
"The performances are showing that the team are not accountable. 
"It's all about the start and Arsenal have nor started well for so many games now. I'm not expecting Arsenal to start well. 
"I don't feel they get themselves up for certain games, there's not enough accountability. And it's just exactly what happens every season at this stage." 
Wright then singled out Olivier Giroud for his performance against Watford on Tuesday: 
Was he injured or wasn't he injured? 
"Two minutes into the game he signalled that he wasn't right. He knew that his ankle wasn't quite right. It was the most pitiful 45 minutes I've ever seen from a centre-forward and he was rightly taken off." 
"I would be absolutely livid with him because it's all about the start." 
Thoughts on Wright's comments?
